The movie was also a disaster in other parts of the world and also in the home country [[India]]. ==Piracy== Yash Raj Films (USA) Inc. has previously commenced criminal and civil copyright infringement actions in various jurisdictions in the United States. On June 30, 2003, the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey handed down the following Judgments: *Judgment in the amount of $94,823.00 against an Edison, NJ retail business operated under the name Gunjan and its owners Ninand Patel, Priya Patel, Vrusti Corporation and Archurusti Corp., a rising out of their sale of counterfeit copies of Yash Raj Films. *Judgment for damages in the amount of $2,300,000.00 and $29,894.00 in legal fees against Bharat Mehta the owner of the replication business Media Dimensions Inc located in Austin, Texas for the unauthorized replication of counterfeit copies of Yash Raj Films.[http://www.yashrajfilms.com/News/NewsDetails.aspx?NewsID=6c737bf7-6805-46a9-ab27-3b003421d7b1] ==Venture with Disney== Yash Raj Films even made India's first 3d Animated movie [[Roadside Romeo]] in collaboration with [[Disney India|Walt Disney Company]].[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1050739/] ==Films== As a distributor '''YRF USA''' has released various movies in the [[United States]].Some of them are: *[[Ta Ra Rum Pum]] (2007) ...
